title: Firefox won't allow me to access facebook.com
content:
I love Firefox, I use it on all my devices. And daily I access facebook.com on this browser, it's been working flawlessly - until yesterday. Yesterday, using Firefox (ver 130.0.1) on my Windows 10 PC, I tried accessing a FB page which I visit sometimes: https://www.facebook.com/OpenOscillator

Rather than reaching that page, I got a white screen with this error message: "Sorry, something went wrong." And since then, even visiting the Facebook home page (or any other FB page) has the same error message.

Today I tried the same thing on my Mac (OS 14.3), using Firefox and logging into facebook.com, which worked as usual. But when I went to https://www.facebook.com/OpenOscillator, I got the same error message: "Sorry, something went wrong." And as happened on my PC, now on my Mac I can't access any FB page on Firefox.

And just to mention, I've rebooted both the PC and the Mac, yet this problem persists on both devices.

Trying this same exercise on Edge on my PC does not have this problem. Nor does it happen when doing this on Safari on my Mac.

So, this problem has only been happening on Firefox. I can no longer access facebook.com with Firefox. Do you guys have any ideas how to solve this?

Helpful to know: Do you have the same outcome if you visit this FB page: https://www.facebook.com/OpenOscillator

Thanks for your assistance! Steven
creator: steven131

title: Syncronized tabs discrepancy
content: I used the "synchronized tabs" feature in the firefox sidebar to open all the tabs that were on my phone on my desktop, they were in total 1193 and this was said by firefox itself(yes i have a lot of tabs open, i moved them to desktop to sort them). Now when they finished loading i noticed a few failed to load, and remain about:blank even though i knew i didnt have any such tabs on my phone, to fix these few tabs i was planning to get a list of urls of all the tabs i opened and a list of those that were on my phone and compare them with a tool online. I got the list of tabs on my desktop through an addon, i checked the number of lines and it matched that that i got from the "syncronized tabs" feature. I got the list of tabs on my android by using the "share all tabs" feature available when you click the three dots on the top right when opening the tabs screen. Once i sent that last list to my desktop i was perplexed, the number of tabs was significantly higher, 1228 to be exact. And when i compared the lists with my online tool the results were even stranger, both lists were missing tabs from the other list, hundreds of them in fact, how is this possible? how do i even know that i got all my tabs if so many are missing from both of these features? Useful screenshot below

title: System Wide settings configuration for Ubuntu
content:
I have a closed Ubuntu installation I use to clone and quickly setup a VM. The closed system uses a proxy with restricted access to the internet, as such I would like to give it systemwide settings that will effect new and existing users.

I have attempted to use /etc/firefox/syspref.js, and apturl.js in /etc/firefox/pref/apturl.js. I have setting in EnvVars for HTTPS_PROXY and HTTP_PROXY pointing at the proxy http://proxy:8080. It seems by default firefox does not look at that.

Secondly I wanted to turn off the site warnings for intranet sites using the following options: pref("security.insecure_field_warning.contextual.enabled,false") pref("security.certerrors.permanentOverride,false") pref("network.stricttransportsecurity.preloadlist,false") pref("security.enterprise_roots.enabled,true")

Seeing as nothing I try seems to be working, and the potentials solutions were for older versions, is there a way I can do this?

Thanks JJ

title: One cause of Windows Photos app crashing = Firefox
content:
Hello everyone,

This is NOT a question. I just want to share this info to others.

Yesterday, I was tearing my hair because the Photos app in my Windows 11 just kept on crashing when I opened any image file (jpg, png, etc). "Crashing" means the window was partially displayed on the screen but not the content, then two or three seconds later, it just closed itself!

Then by pure chance, I had to exit Firefox. After that, Photos app was working just fine. I was thinking "what?" Then I reopened Firefox. Photos app crashed on opening. So I was 100% sure that for some reason, running Firefox would crash Photos app.

So I think I had to share this information to the community. Here I am.

Have a nice day.

title: unable to open emails from Royal Mail on Firefox, but they WILL open on Safari and DuckDuckGo
content:
Hello!

I have a problem which seems to be only with my Firefox browser regarding Royal Mail emails!

I use a Mac desktop computer, and my email account is with btinternet.com

Recently, when I get an email notification about an (expected) delivery from Royal Mail, the actual content of the email is blank when I’m using Firefox as my browser.

At first, I assumed this was btinternet.com blocking Royal Mail, for some reason. However, I discovered yesterday that this problem does not exist when I access my email via Safari or DuckDuckGo! I can access the content of the emails just fine if I use either of these other browsers.

I also have Firefox installed on my iPad AND on my Android phone. The same thing happens on both of these devices as well—so this is not an issue with my Mac computer. I can access the content of the email from Royal Mail via either Safari (on my iPad) or DuckDuckGo (on iPad AND my android phone.) However, neither of these will show me the email when I use Firefox.

I can access the actual Royal Mail website with Firefox on my computer, no problem. It’s just when I try to open emails from them that the problem arises.

No idea what is causing this anomaly. I can’t pinpoint exactly when it started, but it’s been going on for at least a month and maybe more.

I use the latest version of Firefox at all times on all devices, and my operating systems are up to date on my devices as well. (I have the latest version of Sonoma on my Mac, I have iOS 17.7 on my iPad, and whatever the latest update for Motorola e14 is.)

I’m hoping you can offer a bit of advice. This is very annoying, as Firefox is my default browser on both my Mac AND my Motorola phone.
creator: janfol

title: Problems with Best i5 Laptop and Mozilla Firefox – Any Advice?
content:
Hey everyone,

I’m experiencing some frustrating issues with Mozilla Firefox on my best i5 laptop. My laptop is fairly new and handles most tasks smoothly, but when it comes to browsing with Firefox, I’m running into several problems.

Here’s what’s happening:

Lagging and Slowness: Whenever I open multiple tabs or use web apps, Firefox becomes sluggish. Pages load slowly, and switching between tabs is much slower than expected.

Freezing: Occasionally, Firefox will freeze for a few seconds, especially when I’m using extensions or trying to stream videos or handle media-heavy websites.

High CPU Usage: I’ve checked my Task Manager, and Firefox is using a surprisingly high amount of CPU resources, which is affecting the overall performance of my best i5 laptop.

Battery Drain: It seems like Firefox is draining my battery faster compared to other browsers, which is frustrating since I rely on my laptop for long periods of usage.

I’ve tried clearing the cache, disabling extensions, and even reinstalling Firefox, but the issues remain. Given that my laptop is one of the best i5 laptops, I’m surprised by these performance problems.

Has anyone else experienced similar issues with Firefox on an i5 laptop? Are there any tweaks, settings, or specific solutions that might help improve performance? I’d appreciate any advice or recommendations to get the most out of Firefox on my system.

Thanks in advance for your help! Looking forward to your suggestions!
creator: moorejulie199

title: Mozilla Firefox Profiler Power
content:
Hi,

I am running a simple web based chat app on a local server. I want to compare the energy usage between three version of the app, using long polling, websocket and webRTC for communication. Do you have a guide on how to parse these output files so that I can sort on the various energy usage components? In the visual capture of the profile all the data is available nicely to see. I would like to use the JSON files to make tables of total energy usage etc.

Best regards, Anders
